Arne F. Meyer

Studying the (visual) brain in action

    • Head and eye movements in freely moving mice

Meyer AF*#, Poort J*, O’Keefe J, Sahani M, Linden JF. A head-mounted camera system integrates detailed behavioral monitoring with multichannel electrophysiology in freely moving mice. Neuron, 2018, 100, 46-60. Design files and code.

Meyer AF, Williamson R, Linden JF, and Sahani M. Models of neuronal stimulus-response functions: elaboration, estimation and evaluation. Front. Syst. Neurosci., 2017, 10, 109. Code.

Meyer AF#, Diepenbrock JP, Ohl FW, and Anemüller J. Fast and robust estimation of spectro-temporal receptive fields using stochastic approximations. J Neurosci Methods, 2015, 246, 119-133.

Meyer AF#, Diepenbrock JP, Ohl FW, and Anemüller J. Temporal variability of spectro-temporal receptive fields in the anesthetized auditory cortex. Frontiers in Computational Neuroscience, 2014, Vol. 8(165)

Meyer AF#, Diepenbrock JP, Happel MF, Ohl FW, and Anemüller J. Discriminative Learning of Receptive Fields from Responses to Non-Gaussian Stimulus Ensembles. PLOS ONE, 2014, Vol. 9(4), pp. e93062.

Kollmeier B., Schaedler MR, Meyer AF, Anemüller J, Meyer, BT. Do we need STRFs for Cocktail Parties? - On the relevance of physiologically motivated features for human speech perception derived from automatic speech recognition (ASR). Adv Exp Med Biol. 2013;787:333-41. doi: 10.1007/978-1-4614-1590-9_37.
